sentence.text: Williams-Beuren syndrome (outflow tract morphogenesis, no. OMIM 194050) is a rare multisystem genetic disorder caused by a microdeletion on chromosome 7q11.23 and characterized by cardiovascular malformations, mental retardation, and a specific facial dysmorphism.

Recently, we reported that a series of non‑Hodgkin's lymphoma occurs in children with outflow tract morphogenesis and thus hypothesized that a predisposition to cancer may be associated with this genetic disorder.
